body.name: SinLoon 4 Knob Cooling Fan Speed Controller PC 8 Channels Fan Hub for CPU Case HDD VGA PWM Fan PCI Bracket 12V Fan Control- SATA Power Supply (SATA 4 Knob)
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Saturday, February 17 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 28 mins
features: 【Knob Adjust】4 Knob Cooling Fan Speed Controller , This cooling fan hub is equipped with the independent speed controller.
【Function】PC 8 Channels Fan Hub Reduce speed to reduce noise & power consumption when computer parts are free. Increase speed to reduce computer part temperature when computer parts are busy.
【Material】4 Knob Cooling Fan Speed Controller adopts plastic and metal materials, durable, reliable, with low loss and low heat.
【Universal】Widely used for PC computer water cooling system, easy to install.Fan Interface: 4PIN (3PIN Can be connected).Power Supply Interface: SATA.
【Save space】SinLoon PC 8 Channels Fan Hub The governor is installed in the PCI position of the chassis, which is convenient for installation and does not take up space.
body.description: Product Specifications: Item Type:Cooling Fan Speed Controller Material:Plastic+Metal Supply Voltage: 0-12V Connectable Fans: 8 Fan Interface: 4PIN (3PIN Can be connected) Power: 35W Adjustment Method: 4 Manual Adjustment Knob Power Supply Interface: SATA Installation Position: PCI Position of PC Chassis Package: 1 x Cooling Fan Speed Controller Made of high-quality material, durable, firm and stable Professional high speed regulating circuit, high performance, support for SATA Universal: Widely used for PC computer water cooling system, easy to install.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Really nice and after 2 months still working great
reviews.reviewText: I’ve used this in my pc for the last 2+ months and it has worked perfectly and still works perfectly

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars NOT PWM. Build your own instead of trusting Amazon with a basic PWM controller.
reviews.reviewText: This board is not a PWM fan controller.It seems to use voltage on the base of the (pnp?) transistors to control how much voltage goes to the fan, which results in a narrow range of control. Would not recommend even for 3-wire fans.Your best bet if your stuck with this board is to just remove all the useless components (Transistors, Potentiometers), place a jumper from pin 3 to pin 2 on where the transistors were (bypasses 12v directly to fan), and add your own 5v-tolerant microcontroller with 25kHz PWM output to pin 4 of each fan connector.I also bought another PWM fan controller off Amazon and it fails to start my Noctua fans. You would literally be better off building your own PWM fan controller if your budget is anywhere below $75.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Bought this to control multiple fans on my sons PC , worked quite well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Died after 2 months.... That is the good news.
reviews.reviewText: Switch ran fine for 2 months. A few days ago, my new computer was locking up (no errors,) Reboot and sometimes it would run for a couple of hours and then freeze again. I then noticed my fans were not running. Tried to adjust the switch, but nothing happened. When I unplugged the controller, noticed that my freeze issue seemed to go away... A day later.... computer is running fine. Controller is going in the trash.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: SATA Power connector literally just fell off, too late for replacement.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Doesn't create a PWM signal, Very small range of adjustment.
reviews.reviewText: (Video shows the adjustment range for the fan speed, look at the line on the graph behind my hand, the lowest the blue line goes is lowest fan speed, and the highest the blue line goes is the max fan speed, notice how little the knob moves to get this range)Tried to use this to control some 4 pin noctua fans. (PWM fans)The fans would only work if the knob was turned to max, then turned down until you got the speed you wanted. (To overcome the extra voltage needed to start spinning the fan)After a computer shutdown, the fans would not spin back up since they did not have enough voltage (more on that later.)After further inspect of the PCB which includes nothing besides an amplifier and a potentiometer (the knob you turn) there is no way for this to create a PWM signal to control the speed of the fan correctly, which is why i'm confused there are 4 pin fan connectors on this product.After further inspection with an oscilloscope i found out that it does nothing besides vary the 12V signal from 0V to 12V (in a very small adjustment range, see the video).Would not recommend this product if you are planning on connecting 4 pin fans to this. This might work OK with 3 pin fans which are DC voltage control only. Product shouldn't lie about being PWM capable along with putting 4 pin connectors on it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Very cheap material. The data plug wiggles and it’s about to break. I didn’t even put pressure.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Sucks dont buy it

reviews.reviewText: Got this product & I reduced my fans x 4 . Amazing tool that works great .

reviews.reviewTitle: Very good let’s me control the fans individually 5/5
reviews.reviewText: Worth the price let’s me individually control each fan

reviews.reviewTitle: Would not work properly for me...
reviews.reviewText: Terrible... It would not allow gradual speed changes of my fans. It only allowed two speeds- low and high. Slow barely moved at all, and high was terribly loud. I don't understand why it was acting this way, because it should be gradual adjustments, so I sent it back as defective. I bought a front panel one from a different company, and it worked perfectly when used with the same fans.
